page.title: 14THE REDGRAVE THEATRE (cont.)
page.content: Sir Michael Redgrave placed a 'time Capsule' in the foundations. Princess Margaret opened the theatre and watched a play,specially written for the event by William Douglas Home. She returned for the 10th Anniversary and again witnessed the first showing of another play by Mr Home. The theatre is paid for by local support groups and contributions from local people and companies. One of the fund raising events is the annual garden party in the grounds.This is well supported by many popular actors and actresses. The main theatre is quite small and retains an intimate quality. Meals and snacks are available and the Castle Club Room is open to private members. The name of this club is a reminder of the original theatre which started in a disused barn in Castle Street.
